required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of the KineSpring® System to Evaluate Symptom Relief in Patients With Medial Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multi-Center, Pilot Study to Evaluate Symptom Relief in Patients With Medial Knee Osteoarthritis (OA) Treated With the KineSpring® Knee Implant for Load Reduction

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot study is to collect data on the safety and effectiveness of the KineSpring System in patients with primarily unicompartmental medial knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: The KineSpring System is indicated to treat symptoms of pain and loss of knee function in patients with a diagnosis of osteoarthritis or post-traumatic osteoarthritis in the medial compartment of the knee. The KineSpring System is indicated for patients with osteoarthritis of severity that does not require knee joint replacement.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint of this pilot study is the rate of individual patient success at 24 months.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure and at 6 weeks and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
At time of procedure and through 60 month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Safety outcomes will be determined by evaluating by the type, frequency, severity, and relatedness of adverse events through the 60 month timepoint.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, 6 weeks, and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: High-Activity Arthroplasty Score (HAAS) Patient Reported Outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, 6 weeks, and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Knee Pain Severity Score using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) (0-100).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, 6 weeks, and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) Patient Reported Outcome measure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, 6 weeks, and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Participant Global Assessment: Patient's assessment of their global status based on their OA.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, 6 weeks, and 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis (WOMAC) Patient Reported Outcome measure. KOOS contains the full and original version of the WOMAC questionnaire and thus WOMAC scores will be calculated from the KOOS questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure, pre-hospital discharge, and 3, 12, and 60 mths post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Radiographic assessment to evaluate radiographic changes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed preprocedure and at 24 months post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: MRI assessment to evaluate MRI changes.

arm_group.description: In this single arm study, the KineSpring System will be surgically implanted in all 60 study patients.

intervention.description: The KineSpring System is designed to treat pain and loss of function secondary to medial knee OA by absorbing joint overload.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with symptoms of knee pain and loss of knee function.
- Patients with a diagnosis of osteoarthritis or post-traumatic osteoarthritis in the medial compartment of the knee.
- Radiographic confirmation of mild to moderate medial compartment knee OA
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that that require knee joint replacement.
- Symptomatic OA in lateral compartment or patellofemoral compartment.
- Known sensitivity to metals including cobalt, chromium, iron, or nickel
- Rheumatoid arthritis, other forms of inflammatory joint disease

facility.name: University of Minnesota, Department of Orthopaedic Surgery
Univerisy of Virginia, Dept. of Orthopaedic Surgery
